description: Around 2,000 visitors are expected on the opening weekend of the new gurdwara in Camberley.
title: Surrey's first gurdwara set to open in Camberley in May
title_page: Surrey's first gurdwara set to open in Camberley in May  - BBC News
maintext:
Surrey's first gurdwara is set to open on the site of a former Ministry of Defence building in Camberley in the spring.
The Gura Nanak Gurdwara Camberley charity raised Â£1.5m to transform the ex-military base into a place of worship which is to open on 3 May.
A spokesperson from the charity told the BBC that as "a community we are absolutely thrilled that we can announce a grand opening date".
They added it is the "culmination of a two-decade search" and that despite "highs and lows" the "continuing unwavering support means the community has grown from strength to strength."
